job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: Job ID  27033  Posted  12-Aug-2021  Service line  Advisory Segment  Role type  Full-time  Location(s)  Richardson - Texas - United States of America CBRE’s Data Science Center of Excellence (CoE) is looking to hire a based out of our Richardson, Texas campus Remote work is an option for qualified candidates. S/he would be one of the torchbearers of Data-inspired work across CBRE and will help shape Data Science/Analytics for one or more key business lines. As one of the founding companies in Commercial Real Estate (CRE), CBRE is the world’s largest company spanning the spectrum of CRE services. The CoE was established to help and, promote and productionize Data-inspired products/projects. This role will assist and support the evaluation of proprietary and third-party data, to develop machine learning algorithms to interrogate data, and to develop and implement a scaling stack to develop products for the purpose of business intelligence. Works on assigned cross-functional research or analytical projects leveraging advanced computational algorithms.  Applies the tools of modern data science using open source architecture to the analysis of CBRE's proprietary data  Supports data research efforts for product development for internal and external clients.  Develops custom algorithms for solving real estate business problems across a wealth of structured and unstructured data across multiple data sources.  Supports the Senior Scientist in the tracking and evaluation of data sources.  Performs other duties as assigned. No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. May coordinate and assign tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to internal customers. Ability to effectively present information. Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis. Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret complex documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires advanced analytical and quantitative skills. Demonstrated knowledge of R and/or Python, together with SQL.  Demonstrated knowledge of standard machine learning algorithms, based on "An Introduction to Statistical Learning" by James et. al. or similar textbook. Demonstrated knowledge of strengths, weaknesses, and real-world performance of the ML algorithms.  Demonstrated knowledge of web scrapping and data preprocessing. Decisions made with thorough understanding of procedures, company policies, and business practices to achieve general results and deadlines. Responsible for setting work unit and/or project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to department.  SAFETY
